next double_crochet three half_double_crochet in the chain 5 space at the end of the row turn 36 stitches row 6 through completion repeat row 2 -5 eleven more times and end on a row 4 of the repeat or if you prefer add on additional four-row repeats to make an infinity scarf and end on a row 4 of the repeat when you reach your endpoint cut the yarn end to a length of about three times the length of the cowl end and pull the yarn tail through the last stitch final seam and finishing thread the long yarn tail through a darning needle lay the cowl out so that you have the ends matched up to avoid having a seam that puckers do not pull the stitches too tightly make the final seam by sewing a simple whip stitch to join the two ends start by running the needle under a corresponding loop on the top of the other side of the cowl then catch one outer loop of a stitch on one side and the corresponding outer loop on the other side and pull the needle through see photo to the right repeat for each pair of corresponding outer loops all the way down to form your seam you will meet back up with the loose end from the very start of the cowl you can tie a small knot if you like with these two ends and then sew in these two ends so that they do not show wet blocking run the cowl under cold water until saturated squeeze out the excess water with a towel and do not wring lay the cowl out on blocking mats or a bed covered with a towel pin out the cowl stretching it slightly so that it forms a rectangle line up the picots on both sides and pin through both picots so that they are pulled out and even along the edges let dry
